articles.title: Curbing Cyber Frauds in Digital India.
articles.summary: India’s cyberspace is busier than ever, carrying crores of transactions and interactions every day. Over 86% of households are now connected to the internet, reflecting the remarkable progress under the Digital India initiative. The expanding digital landscape has enabled citizens to access digital services at their fingertips. At the same time, it has also widened the attack surface for cyber frauds, making cybersecurity a national priority.

articles.title: PM Modi meets Manipur CM, his two deputies in New Delhi
articles.summary: BJP's Yumnam Khemchand Singh was sworn in as CM of Manipur on February 4, reinstating the NDA government along with Kuki legislator Nemcha Kipgen and Naga MLA Losii Dikho as his deputies, marking a fresh spin on shared governance in a multi-ethnic state riven by the Meitei-Kuki conflict. Governor AK Bhalla also administered the oath of office to BJP's Konthoujam Govindas and Khuraijam Loken Singh of NPP as cabinet ministers at the Lok Bhavan ceremony.

articles.title: Trump's tariff game might not be over just yet, here's what US admin is planning after key SC verdict

President Trump also threatened higher duties on countries exploiting the ruling, aiming to replace invalidated levies with legally sustainable measures under Section 232 and Section 301.

articles.title: SCOTUS ruling: Emergency powers under judicial check — lessons for India
articles.summary: The US Supreme Court held unambiguously that the President does not possess emergency powers under the IEEPA to impose tariffs without Congressional approval and accordingly struck down the tariffs. Indian courts can draw an important lesson from this. Clear and unambiguous rulings are critical for both respondents and appellants, notes Najib Shah, former Chairman of the CBIC.

articles.title: India must develop sovereign AI to avoid digital colony risk, says Sarvam AI Co-founder Vivek Raghavan
